Now, more seriously: I tend to think of geeks and tech folks as pragmatic. I switched from PCs and many years of experience with Windows and a big love for Linux to Apple and OSX because it gave me the best of a *nix-powered system (I live on my terminal/iTerm) while having the best indie development ecosystem EVER.  I bought more AMAZING indie software since moving to the Mac than I pirated Windows crappy apps in 10 years… Same thing with the iPad! Be pragmatic: It's the best device out there! If there are other good ones that come out, I'll pragmatically say: "Pick whichever you like best!". As to mobile platforms, iOS is second to none… and by a long shot! </long>
But hey: you can also play Angry Birds on your Xoom! :)

… and, while at it, deal with feeling absolutely ripped off because you got a subpar product for the same (or more) money just because you wanted to feel warm and fuzzy inside that you didn't drink the Kool-Aid.
Get a Motorola Xoom…
… then go play with an iPad and feel great that you're not a fanboy…

I would have said iPad 2 no question, until I got hold of a Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 at Google I/O. I still think the iPad 2 is a stronger product (mainly because there are far more apps available), but the SGT 10.1 is the first really credible iPad competitor in the tablet space. If you prefer Android to iOS, then get the SGT 10.1 and you will not be giving up too much. See my review on this subject here: http://www.xconomy.com/national/2011/05/13/the-ipad-finally-has-a-worthy-rival-samsungs-galaxy-tab-10-1/

I'm spending some quality time with my wife's iPad2 these days and I have to say that on the positive side I never thought I would enjoy reading magazines as much as I'm enjoying it from the couch - Wired and Brazilian's VEJA and INFO being the main ones.
